intro: Ptychopyxis costata var. oblanceolata, commonly known as the narrow-leaf ptychopyxis, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its elongated, narrow leaves that are often slightly curled at the edges. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. This variety is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
